oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Southern Shindig - 1950-05-12 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: NBC syndication Southern Shindig, originating from WSM. Originally broadcast 1950-05-12, part 1. Personnel include David Cobb (announcer), Milton Estes (host), Owen Bradley and his Orchestra (performers), Owen Bradley Quintet (performers), the Jordanaires including Bob Hubbard (performers), Jack Shook (performer), Annie Lou & Danny (performers), Dutch Gordon (Owen Bradley Orchestra, trombone), Cecil Bailey (performer), Dottie Dillard (performer), Harry Draper (Owen Bradley Orchestra, violin, name unconfirmed), Oscar Eiler (Owen Bradley Orchestra, cello), Wilda Tinsley (Owen Bradley Orchestra, violin, name unconfirmed), Harold Johnson (Owen Bradley Orchestra, violin). Milton Estes states that this is the last program in the series, and that a Red Foley hosted program will follow on Monday. Part 2: http://cmfdigitization.cmf.int:2011/cdm/ref/collection/musicaudio/id/536
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Jordanaires; Jack Shook; Annie Lou & Danny; Owen Bradley; Owen Bradley Orchestra; Dutch Gordon
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Opening statement (David Cobb) -- Theme -- David Cobb introduces Milton Estes -- Opening statement (Milton Estes) -- Milton Estes introduces the Jordanaires -- Mountain Girl (The Jordanaires) -- Milton Estes and David Cobb talk with the Jordanaires -- Mountain Girl (excerpt) (The Jordanaires) -- Milton Estes introduces Jack Shook -- To My Sorrow (Jack Shook vocals) -- Milton Estes talks about Jack Shook -- Milton Estes and David Cobb introduce Annie Lou & Danny -- Broken Down Merry-Go-Round (Annie Lou & Danny) -- Milton Estes introduces Dutch Gordon -- Baby Face (Dutch Gordon trombone) -- Milton Estes and David Cobb talk about Dutch Gordon -- Mail Call (Malcolm [?]) -- Milton Estes reads letters from listeners [continued in part 2]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Southern shindig (Radio program); Cobb, David (Announcer); Estes, Milton, 1914-1963; Bradley, Owen; Owen Bradley Quintet; Jordanaires (Musical group); Hubbard, Bob, 1928-; Shook, Jack; Annie Lou and Danny; Dill, Annie Lou Stockard; Dill, Danny; Gordon, Dutch; Bailey, Cecil (Vocalist); Shook, Jack; Dillard, Dottie; Johnson, Harold (Musician)
